  27. __author__ = 'jannis@itisme.org (Jannis Andrija Schnitzer)'
  29. class RecursiveDictionary(dict):
  30. """RecursiveDictionary provides the methods rec_update and iter_rec_update
  31. that can be used to update member dictionaries rather than overwriting
  32. them."""
  33. def rec_update(self, other, **third):
  34. """Recursively update the dictionary with the contents of other and
  35. third like dict.update() does - but don't overwrite sub-dictionaries.
  37. Example:
  38. >>> d = RecursiveDictionary({'foo': {'bar': 42}})
  39. >>> d.rec_update({'foo': {'baz': 36}})
  40. >>> d
  41. {'foo': {'baz': 36, 'bar': 42}}
  42. """
  43. try:
  44. iterator = other.iteritems()
  45. except AttributeError:
  46. iterator = other
  47. self.iter_rec_update(iterator)
  48. self.iter_rec_update(third.iteritems())
  50. def iter_rec_update(self, iterator):
  51. for (key, value) in iterator:
  52. if key in self and\
  53. isinstance(self[key], dict) and isinstance(value, dict):
  54. self[key] = RecursiveDictionary(self[key])
  55. self[key].rec_update(value)
  56. else:
  57. self[key] = value
  60. # changed version
  61. class RecursiveDictionaryWithExcludes(RecursiveDictionary):
  62. """
  63. Same as RecursiveDictionary, but respects a list of keys that should be excluded from recursion
  64. and handled like a normal dict.update()
  65. """
  66. def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
  67. self.rec_excluded_keys = kwargs.pop('rec_excluded_keys', ())
  68. super(RecursiveDictionaryWithExcludes, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs)
  70. def iter_rec_update(self, iterator):
  71. for (key, value) in iterator:
  72. if key in self and\
  73. isinstance(self[key], dict) and isinstance(value, dict) and\
  74. key not in self.rec_excluded_keys:
  75. self[key] = RecursiveDictionaryWithExcludes(self[key],
  76. rec_excluded_keys=self.rec_excluded_keys)
  77. self[key].rec_update(value)
  78. else:
  79. self[key] = value
